org.gradle.api.attributes

Class AttributeValue<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gradle.api.attributes.AttributeValue<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the attribute

    public class AttributeValue<T>
extends Object
    Represents an optional attribute value, as found in an attribute container. There are 3 possible cases:
    • present is the default, and represents an attribute with an actual value
    • missing used whenever an attribute is known of the AttributesSchema of a consumer, no value was provided.
    • unknown used whenever an attribute is unknown of the AttributesSchema of a consumer, implying that no value was provided. It is different from the missing case in the sense that the consumer had no chance to provide a value here.
    During attribute matching, this can be used to implement various strategies.
    Since:
    3.3

      static <T> AttributeValue<T> missing()
      Creates a missing attribute value, used to represent the fact that the attribute is known but the consumer didn't want to express a value for it (it doesn't care).
